paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: 3–4% of the Afro-Caribbean and African American population

individual_records.phenotype_details: may present with hypertensive or uraemic cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The disease penetrance associated with this mutation is thought to be low; however, the prevalence of hypertension and diabetes is high in this ethnic group such that misdiagnosis of hATTR-CM as hypertensive or uraemic cardiomyopathy is likely in a proportion.

functional_data.summary: The p.V142I variant is associated with low penetrance and may lead to misdiagnosis.

variants.segregation_data: Does not segregate clearly due to low penetrance.
variants.population_frequency: 3–4% in Afro-Caribbean and African American populations
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of the p.V142I variant is complicated by the presence of other health conditions in the population.
key_quotes: The disease penetrance associated with this mutation is thought to be low; however, the prevalence of hypertension and diabetes is high in this ethnic group such that misdiagnosis of hATTR-CM as hypertensive or uraemic cardiomyopathy is likely in a proportion.

patients.phenotype: typically presents at a younger age with a combination of neuropathy and cardiomyopathy

functional_data.summary: The p.V50M variant is associated with early-onset symptoms.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant disease burden.

patients.phenotype: typically presents at a younger age with a combination of neuropathy and cardiomyopathy

functional_data.summary: The p.T80A variant is associated with a significant disease burden.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant disease burden.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
